alert.note: Alert for Hillsborough (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 30 at 5:08AM EDT until August 30 at 11:06PM EDT by NWS Tampa Bay
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Florida... Alafia River At Riverview near US 301 affecting Hillsborough County. .Storm surge caused by Hurricane Idalia will cause major to record flooding on the Alafia river at Riverview. For the Alafia...including Riverview near US 301...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. This will approach or surpass the flood of record. * WHERE...Alafia River at Riverview near US 301. * WHEN...From early this morning to late this evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 AM EDT Wednesday the stage was 5.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 4.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:00 AM EDT Wednesday was 5.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate above flood stage with a maximum value of 6.5 feet late this morning. It will fall below flood stage late this afternoon. - Flood stage is 4.2 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.2 feet on 09/06/2004. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (5 am EDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Alafia River Riverview near US 4.2 5.4 Wed 4 am 1.8 1.5 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by noon.this evening at 815 PM EDT.
